channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing litter and dumped Xmas tree, 26th January
item.description:
Overflowing litter and dumped Xmas tree. The litter overflowing seems to be a weekly occurrence. Surely it would be sensible to investigate and take appropriate action

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Andrews Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car has been parked there for at least 2 months, 26th January
item.description:
When I pull out of my drive I have to park further up the road, Iet me explain my wife had vascular stroke 18 months ago, she goes to the pavilion and to the spa 4 days a week, she cannot get in the car in my drive so she has cross the road and walk to it, basically the car is in wrong position for me to park, yours truly T. Wilson

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead horse on footpath corner of Mulberry Way and Church Manor Way, 26th January
item.description:
A dead horse which has been there for a couple of months is on the footpath on the corner of Mulberry Way and Church Manor Way. This was reported about a month ago but has still not been removed. Please can this be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pole outside my house, 26th January
item.description:
I previously reported this traffic sign ref - 7953204 which was put outside our house as the pole was extremely wobbly causing danger to my two young kids when walking down the steps. This pole was removed and today this has been inserted again? As you can see from the photo the cement moves and we have a lamppost on which the traffic sign can be put on. Why have you put this back again? This will cause danger yet again. Can this pleased be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elstree Gardens, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 187 camden high street EE shop, 26th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 183, Camden High Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 26th January
item.description:
This pothole has been there for years. It needs to be fixed as it’s worse than it’s ever been before, it’s very deep. Extremely dangerous and cannot be avoided as it’s in the width restriction zone on Grafton Road.
